subSections.title: Readings
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
[[File:Grus_japonensis_in_flight_at_Akan_International_Crane_Center.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|鶴}} (''tazu'', ''tsuru''): the Japanese crane, ''[[Grus japonensis]]'']] {{Commonscat|Gruidae}} [[File:Origami-crane.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|鶴}} (''tsuru''): a paper [[origami]] crane]] {{Commonscat|Origami crane}} [[File:Japanese_crest_Tsuru_no_Maru.svg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|鶴}} (''tsuru''): a crane {{m|ja|家紋|tr=kamon||family crest}}]] {{Commonscat|Tsuru mon (Japanese crests of crane)}}
{{ja-kanjitab|たず|yomi=k}} From {{der|ja|ojp|-|sort=たず}}.{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}{{R:Daijirin}} By one analysis, this may be a compound of {{affix|ja|sort=たず|田|tr1=ta|t1=rice paddy|pos1=a common place where cranes can be found|つ|tr2=tsu|t2=crane? large bird?}}. {{rendaku2|sort=たず|tsu|dzu, {{upright|modern}} zu}} This ''tsu'' is probably the ''tsu'' in ''tsuru'' (see below).

subSections.text:
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{IPA|[ta̠zɯᵝ]|[ta̠d͡zɯᵝ]|lang=ja}} {{qualifier|dialect}}

subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * {{ja-l|田鶴}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|たず|hhira=たづ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=たず|archaic|poetic}} a [[crane]]: a large, long-legged and long-necked [[bird]], member of the [[family]] or [[clade]] ''[[Gruidae]]''
#* {{RQ:Manyoshu|7|1199}}; [http://etext.lib.virginia.edu/japanese/manyoshu/Man7Yos.html#1199 text here]
#*: 藻苅舟 奥榜来良之 妹之嶋 形見之浦尓 '''鶴'''翔所見
#*:: もかりふね おきこぎくらし いもがしま かたみのうらに '''たづ'''かけるみゆ
#*:: ''Mo kari fune / oki kogi kurashi / Imogashima / Katami no ura ni / '''tazu''' kakeru miyu''
#*:: Rowing the seaweed-gathering boat out to sea and back again, I saw the '''cranes''' soaring by Katami inlet on Imogashima

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: This reading is now reserved for poetry.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|つる|ツル}}

# a [[crane]]: a large, long-legged and long-necked [[bird]], member of the [[family]] or [[clade]] ''[[Gruidae]]''
# short for {{ja-l|折鶴||orizuru}}: a [[paper]] [[crane]], the archetypical [[origami]] design

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: As with many words that name organisms, this word is often written in katakana when used in biology contexts.

subSections.title: Derived terms
Idioms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|凍て鶴|いてづる}}: “frozen crane” → a metaphor for something [[stock still]] and unmoving, from the way a crane will [[freeze]] when hunting

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|つ|yomi=k}}
{{der|ja|ojp|-|sort=つ}}. Only found in compounds. Uncertain derivation. May be a truncation of ''tsuru'', or an ancient form of its own. Not used in modern Japanese.

subSections.text:

* {{ja-r|鶴駕|かくが}}: the [[imperial]] [[prince]]'s [[carriage]]; a [[mythical]] [[sage]]'s [[vehicle]]

* {{ja-r|鶴首|かくしゅ}}: the act of [[wait]]ing [[impatiently]] in [[anticipation]] of something, [[wait]]ing [[with bated breath]]
* {{ja-r|鶴寿|かくじゅ}}: [[longevity]], [[long]] [[life]]
* {{ja-r|鶴氅|かくしょう}}: a type of [[robe]] with [[crane]] [[feather]]s woven right into the fabric
* {{ja-r|鶴髪|かくはつ}}: [[pure]] [[white]] [[hair]], similar to the pure white of a [[crane]]'s [[wing]]
* {{ja-r|鶴髪童顔|かくはつ どうがん}}: someone with [[white]] [[hair]] but a [[youthful]] [[face]]
* {{ja-r|鶴望|かくぼう}}: the act of [[wait]]ing [[impatiently]] in [[anticipation]] of something, [[wait]]ing [[with bated breath]]
* {{ja-r|鶴翼|かくよく}}: a [[military]] [[formation]] with [[wing]]s on the [[flank]]s, similar to the shape of a [[crane]]'s outspread [[wing]]s
* {{ja-r|鶴林|^かくりん}}: a [[forest]] in India where [[Sakyamuni]] died
* {{ja-r|鶴林寺|^かくりんじ}}: a [[Buddhist]] [[temple]] in [[w:Hyōgo Prefecture|Hyōgo Prefecture]]
{{der-mid}}
* {{ja-r|一鶴|いっかく}}: a [[single]] [[crane]] {{qualifier|rare, only found in idioms}}
* {{ja-r|雲鶴|うんかく}}: [[cloud]]s and [[crane]]s; a common [[design]] [[pattern]] using clouds and cranes; a kind of [[Korean]] [[celadon]] [[bowl]]
* {{ja-r|雲中白鶴|うんちゅう はっかく}}: [[white]] [[crane]]s flying in the [[cloud]]s; a euphemism for a person of [[noble]] [[character]]
* {{ja-r|亀鶴|きかく}}: a [[turtle]] and a [[crane]], symbols of [[longevity]]
* {{ja-r|群鶴|ぐんかく}}: a [[flock]] of [[crane]]s
* {{ja-r|玄鶴|げんかく}}: a [[black]] [[crane]]; an [[old]] crane
* {{ja-r|西鶴|^さいかく}}: a male given name
* {{ja-r|夜鶴|やかく}}: a [[crane]] in the [[night]], particularly a crane's [[call]]
